title: How to Make a Leather Camera Strap

steps.headline: Gather all the things you need.
Attach the swivel hooks to the d-rings.
steps.description: You can slide the hooks through the small slit in the rings.

steps.headline: Size your leather strap.
steps.description:
Decide how long you want the strap to be and then cut to the appropriate length. Allow for at least 2 additional inches on each side as you will be folding the ends to secure hooks in place. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/c\/cd\/Make-a-Leather-Camera-Strap-Step-3Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Make-a-Leather-Camera-Strap-Step-3Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/c\/cd\/Make-a-Leather-Camera-Strap-Step-3Bullet1.jpg\/v4-759px-Make-a-Leather-Camera-Strap-Step-3Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

steps.headline: Lay d-rings on each side of the camera strap and fold over.
Attach the smaller rings to each side of your camera.
steps.description: You may already have a set of rings from a previous camera strap, however, if you chose a different color you may want to purchase new ones.

steps.headline: Remove binder clips from strap when completely dry and use!
